feature_1.description: Protagonist pursuing artistic dreams in Los Angeles
feature_1.reasoning: Both films center on ambitious young artists (Mia/Indy) trying to make it in LA. They face repeated setbacks but persevere, ultimately achieving some level of success in their fields.

feature_2.description: Romance between two passionate, career-driven individuals
feature_2.reasoning: The central relationships (Mia/Sebastian and Indy/Marion) involve two strong-willed people pursuing their own goals. The romances face obstacles due to career ambitions and are bittersweet.

feature_3.description: Nostalgic tone and reverence for the past
feature_3.reasoning: Both films have a nostalgic aesthetic, with La La Land's old Hollywood vibe and Raiders' 1930s setting. They pay homage to classic genres (musicals/adventure serials) while updating them.

feature_4.description: Themes of compromise between artistic integrity and commercial success
feature_4.reasoning: Sebastian grapples with 'selling out' vs. pursuing pure jazz. Indy faces ethical dilemmas between academic ideals and treasure hunting. Both explore the tension of staying true to one's principles.
